text: Pauline F. Hascup (27 March 1909 - October 1977Pauline Hascup) was an American track and field athlete, specialized in the javelin throw in the 1920s; during the early era of women's athletics. She was a member of Paterson Recreation Club. Hascup set the world record in the javelin throw on 26 June 1926 with a distance of 33.07 meters (108 Feet 6 Inches) during the A.A.U. Title Meet at Paterson. However, the record has not been ratified. Later the year she finished second at the national championships in the javelin throw on 10 July 1926 in Philadelphia with a distance of 105-8â…›, behind Lillian Copeland. ==References== ==Other websites== * Newspaper image of Hascup *Newspaper articles of Hascup via myheritage.nl Category:1909 births Category:1977 deaths Category:Javelin throwers Category:American track and field athletes Category:World record holders
title: Pauline Hascup
